Description: A man's waistcoat; round neckline, centre front opening and straight sides. Front made from natural cream silk cloth with predominantly blue stripes (tabby and supplementary warp). Back is made from natural cream tabby woven cotton cloth. Lining made of same material. Beige coloured silk braiding applied to the neckline, right front edge (as worn) and two horizontal pocket openings. Twenty-four round fabric buttons and buttonholes. Some staining under arms.
Production place: Made in: Libya (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Tunisia (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Jordan (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Curator's comments: Donations and Purchases Book Volume 9: 'Arab' and 'Five pieces comprising an Arab costume'; Asia Collections storage intake book: 'Middle East'. In the opinion of Sahar el-Sayed (textile curator, Cairo Textile Museum) these clothes are festive dress, worn by a man living in a rural environment. Garment worn with As1979,14 .1 jacket .3 coat .4 shawl, scarf .5 coat, 'abaya'
